intro: Pleroma virgatum, commonly known as the white-flowered pleroma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white or pink flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
